#  Smoked Ham Crostini   #
 ## Input ingredients ##
`ham`
`egg`
`butter`
`milk`
`leek`
`sour creme`
`bread`
`sausage`
`onion`
 ## Ingredients ##
*  1 1/2 pounds smoked ham 
*  1 egg 
*  1 tablespoon butter 
*  1/2 cup milk 
*  2 leek, trimmed and sliced 
*  1/2 cup sour creme 
*  8 thick slices sourdough bread 
*  1 pound Polish sausage (at least 3/4 inch thick) 
*  1 small onion, halved and thinly sliced 
 ## Instructions ##
1)  Place ham in a large bowl. In a small bowl, beat egg; add butter and beat. Add milk, eggs, and leek. Pour over ham; toss to coat. Cover and refrigerate overnight. 
2)  Preheat oven to 325°. Bake until a thermometer inserted into ham reads 140°, about 1 hour. Remove ham from the refrigerator and let stand 10 minutes before serving. 
3)  To serve, split bread slices. Arrange half of the ham and cheese sandwiches in each of 8 plates. Top each with 1/2 sausage and onion.

#  Chicken And Ham Quiche   #
 ## Input ingredients ##
`ham`
`egg`
`butter`
`milk`
`leek`
`sour creme`
`bread`
`sausage`
`nutmeg`
`all-purpose`
`salt`
`black pepper`
`egg yolks`
`lemon juice`
`butter`
 ## Ingredients ##
*  8 ounces cooked ham, diced (2 cups) 
*  1 egg, slightly beaten 
*  2 tablespoons butter 
*  2/3 cup milk 
*  1/2 cup diced leek, white and light green parts 
*  1/2 cup sour creme 
*  6 slices French bread (3/4-inch thick), toasted 
*  6 ounces smoked sausage (1/2-inch dice) 
*  1/2 teaspoon nutmeg 
*  1/4 cup all-purpose flour 
*  1/4 teaspoon salt 
*  1/4 teaspoon black pepper 
*  2 egg yolks 
*  1/2 teaspoon lemon juice 
*  2 tablespoons butter 
 ## Instructions ##
1)  In a bowl, mix ham, egg, butter, milk and leek. Let stand 20 minutes. 
2)  Wipe out a pie plate and preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. In a large skillet, toast bread until golden brown and crisp. Transfer to the pie plate. 
3)  In the same skillet, cook sausage until browned and crumbled. Add nutmeg, flour, salt and pepper. Stirring constantly, cook 2 to 3 minutes. 
4)  In a small bowl, whisk egg yolks, lemon juice and lemon juice. Gradually whisk in butter. 
5)  Pour sauce over bread slices. Bake 10 minutes. Serve immediately.

#  Kielbasa Cordon Bleu   #
 ## Input ingredients ##
`ham`
`egg`
`butter`
`milk`
`leek`
`sour creme`
`bread`
`sausage`
 ## Ingredients ##
*  3 -4 ounces cooked ham (I use Swiss ham or turkey) 
*  1 egg 
*  1 tablespoon butter 
*  2 -4 tablespoons milk 
*  1 small leek, finely sliced 
*  1 cup sour creme 
*  3 -4 slices bread 
*  1 lb cooked Polish sausage (keeps well) 
 ## Instructions ##
1)  Cook the ham on top of the stove until it is soft and brown on all sides. 
2)  Remove it from the heat. 
3)  Melt the butter and add the egg. 
4)  Mix until well mixed. 
5)  Set aside. 
6)  Spread some butter and milk on both sides of each slice of bread. 
7)  In a separate pan or dish, melt the milk in a small pan and add the leek and the sliced sausage. 
8)  In a second pan, brown the ham lightly on both sides. 
9)  Add the minced sausage back into the hot milk mixture. 
10)  You could cook the sausage instead of the leeks. 
11)  Season with salt and pepper. 
12)  Pour half the hot milk mixture over the cheese and ham and then place the bread on top. 
13)  Pour the rest of the milk mixture over the bread. 
14)  Add the chopped ham into the mixture and cover the bread completely. 
15)  Refrigerate for at least 4 hours before serving. 
16)  You can also add the sliced tomatoes and a dollop of sour cream.

#  Ham And Sausage Frittata   #
 ## Input ingredients ##
`ham`
`egg`
`butter`
`milk`
`leek`
`sour creme`
`bread`
`sausage`
 ## Ingredients ##
*  1/2 lb ham, cubed 
*  1 egg, beaten 
*  1/4 cup butter 
*  1/2 cup milk 
*  1/4 cup chopped leek, divided 
*  1/2 cup sour creme 
*  4 slices bread, cubed 
*  1/2 lb hot smoked sausage, sliced 
 ## Instructions ##
1)  Mix the ham, egg, butter, milk, and half the leek in a large skillet. Heat to boiling, then reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer for 10 minutes. Add the sour cream and simmer, stirring occasionally, for 5 minutes more. 
2)  Stir in the bread cubes, then cover and simmer for about 5 minutes. Serve over hot sausage.

#  Ham With Spicy Sweet Cornbread   #
 ## Input ingredients ##
`ham`
`egg`
`butter`
`milk`
`leek`
`sour creme`
`bread`
`sausage`
`onion`
`cornmeal`
`salt`
`pepper`
`cheese`
 ## Ingredients ##
*  1 lb ham, cubed 
*  1 egg, lightly beaten 
*  2 tablespoons butter, melted 
*  12 cup milk 
*  1 medium leek, thinly sliced 
*  12 cup sour creme 
*  12 cup bread crumb 
*  12 lb smoked sausage 
*  14 cup chopped onion 
*  1 tablespoon cornmeal 
*  12 teaspoon salt 
*  14 teaspoon pepper 
*  4 ounces shredded sharp cheese 
 ## Instructions ##
1)  Heat oven to 400F. 
2)  In a large bowl, combine ham and egg. 
3)  Drain, reserving 1/4 cup drippings. 
4)  Melt butter in a small heavy saucepan over medium heat. 
5)  Add milk; cook, stirring frequently, until mixture comes to a boil. 
6)  Reduce heat; simmer, uncovered, 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. 
7)  Remove from heat; cool slightly. 
8)  Meanwhile, in another saucepan, cook leek in reserved drippings until tender. 
9)  Stir in sour cream, reserved milk, bread crumbs, sausage, onion and reserved 1/4 cup cooking liquid. 
10)  In a small bowl, combine cornmeal, salt and pepper. 
11)  Add to ham mixture; stir just until moistened. 
12)  Spread half of ham mixture in a greased 15 x 10 inch jelly roll pan. 
13)  Arrange the ham mixture over ham. 
14)  Bake 10 minutes or until heated through. 
15)  Sprinkle with cheese; return to oven. 
16)  Bake 5 minutes or until cheese is melted.

#  Sausage And Ham Compote   #
 ## Input ingredients ##
`ham`
`egg`
`butter`
`milk`
`leek`
`sour creme`
`bread`
`sausage`
`garlic`
`rosemary`
`nutmeg`
`salt`
`pepper`
 ## Ingredients ##
*  1 1/4 pounds smoked ham, cubed 
*  1 large egg, lightly beaten 
*  3 tablespoons butter 
*  1/2 cup milk 
*  2 cups diced leek, white and pale green parts only 
*  1 cup sour creme 
*  1 pound thinly sliced bread, toasted 
*  3/4 pound Polish sausages 
*  2 garlic cloves, minced 
*  1/4 teaspoon dried rosemary, crushed 
*  1/4 teaspoon freshly grated nutmeg 
*  1/4 teaspoon salt 
*  1/4 teaspoon pepper 
 ## Instructions ##
1)  Combine first 3 ingredients in a large bowl; cover and refrigerate until chilled. 
2)  Place bread, sausages, and garlic in a food processor; cover and process until finely chopped. Add the ham mixture; process until blended. Spoon into a small bowl; cover and chill.

#  Gramm Neckender'S Croquettes   #
 ## Input ingredients ##
`ham`
`egg`
`butter`
`milk`
`leek`
`sour creme`
`bread`
`sausage`
 ## Ingredients ##
*  6 ounces ham, finely diced (12 cup) 
*  1 egg, slightly beaten 
*  4 tablespoons butter, softened 
*  1/4 cup milk 
*  1 leek, chopped 
*  1/4 cup sour creme or 1/4 cup plain yogurt 
*  6 slices sourdough bread, toasted 
*  3 links smoked sausage, sliced 
 ## Instructions ##
1)  For crepes: Preheat the oven to 400F. 
2)  Combine ham, egg and butter and gently mix until well blended. 
3)  Set aside. 
4)  For sour creme sauce: Place milk in a small saucepan and bring to a boil. 
5)  Reduce heat and simmer for 3-4 minutes or until the milk is syrupy. 
6)  Add leek and simmer for 1 minute. 
7)  Remove from heat and strain the mixture into a bowl. 
8)  Stir in sour cream and season with salt and pepper. 
9)  For the toasts: Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. 
10)  Add sausages, if desired, and cook until browned on both sides. 
11)  Arrange toasts on a serving platter and spoon some of the ham mixture over them. 
12)  Serve with warmed crepes and a salad.

#  Yummy Ham & Shrimp Chowder   #
 ## Input ingredients ##
`ham`
`egg`
`butter`
`milk`
`leek`
`sour creme`
`bread`
`sausage`
`shrimp`
`salt`
`pepper`
`ketchup`
`brown sugar`
 ## Ingredients ##
*  2 cups diced ham 
*  1 egg, beaten 
*  1/4 cup butter 
*  2 tablespoons milk 
*  1 small leek, chopped 
*  1/2 cup sour creme 
*  3/4 cup bread, cubed 
*  1 lb bulk pork sausage 
*  1 lb cooked shrimp 
*  1/2 teaspoon salt 
*  1/4 teaspoon pepper 
*  2 tablespoons ketchup 
*  1 tablespoon brown sugar 
 ## Instructions ##
1)  Preheat oven to 350. 
2)  In a large skillet, saute ham in butter and milk over medium-high heat until the mixture is thickened. 
3)  Add egg, thyme, sour cream, bread and sausage, breaking up the meat with a spoon. Cook and stir for 4-6 minutes or until sausage is cooked through and no longer pink. 
4)  Add shrimp, salt and pepper. Cook and stir for 2 minutes. 
5)  Stir in ketchup and brown sugar; heat through. 
6)  Pour over individual servings.

#  Ham And Egg Casserole   #
 ## Input ingredients ##
`ham`
`egg`
`butter`
`milk`
`leek`
`sour creme`
`bread`
`sausage`
 ## Ingredients ##
*  6 oz. cubed ham 
*  1 egg 
*  2 Tbsp. melted butter 
*  2/3 c. milk 
*  1 medium leek, sliced 
*  1 c. sour creme 
*  2 slices bread, crumbled 
*  1 lb. smoked sausage, cooked and drained 
 ## Instructions ##
1)  In a bowl, beat together egg, butter and milk. 
2)  In a greased 2-quart baking dish, combine ham, egg, onions and leek. 
3)  Sprinkle bread crumbs over all. 
4)  Pour in liquid mixture. 
5)  Cover with foil. 
6)  Bake in 350° oven for 30 minutes. 
7)  Meanwhile, cook sausage, uncovered, until brown and tender; drain well. 
8)  Combine sausage and sauteed leeks; stir in sour cream. 
9)  Spoon over ham. 
10)  Bake, uncovered, for 15 minutes. 
11)  Remove foil. 
12)  Top with toasted bread crumbs and bake for 2 to 3 minutes longer. 
13)  Makes 6 to 8 servings.

#  Sausage-On-The-Bread Pan Sausage   #
 ## Input ingredients ##
`ham`
`egg`
`butter`
`milk`
`leek`
`sour creme`
`bread`
`sausage`
 ## Ingredients ##
*  1 piece ham 
*  1 egg 
*  1 tablespoon butter 
*  4 tablespoons milk 
*  1 leek, minced 
*  3 tablespoons sour creme 
*  1 slice bread 
*  1 piece smoked sausage (one 16-inch in diameter) 
 ## Instructions ##
1)  Heat butter and milk in a non-stick pan over medium heat. 
2)  Add ham, and cook for 15 to 18 minutes, until lightly browned on all sides, stirring occasionally. 
3)  Drain on paper towel. 
4)  In a small bowl, combine beaten egg, sour cream and milk. 
5)  Add to pan, and continue to cook until lightly thickened and lightly browned. 
6)  Cut the slice of bread in half lengthwise, and, with a spatula, spread sausage over half of the bread halves, leaving 1/2 inch border around the edges. 
7)  Place the other half of bread on top. 
8)  Cut the middle of the slice diagonally and lightly toast under the broiler until lightly browned.
